revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Ryan Fredericks | image = Ryan Fredericks 2017.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Fredericks playing for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in 2017 | fullname = Ryan Marlowe Fredericks{{cite web |url=https://www.bdfutbol.com/en/j/j95740.html |title=Fredericks: Ryan Marlowe Fredericks: Player |publisher=BDFutbol |accessdate=5 May 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|10|10|df=y}}{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/144751/ryan-fredericks |title=Ryan Fredericks |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=5 May 2018}} | birth_place = [[Hammersmith]], England | height = {{convert|1.81|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://www.fulhamfc.com/player-profiles/ryan-fredericks |title=Ryan Fredericks |publisher=Fulham F.C. |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180506091752/https://www.fulhamfc.com/player-profiles/ryan-fredericks |archivedate=6 May 2018 |deadurl=yes}} | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | clubnumber = 24 | youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2010 | youthclubs1 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Reserves and Academy|Tottenham Hotspur]] | years1 = 2010–2015 | clubs1 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012 | clubs2 = → [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] (loan) | caps2 = 4 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2014 | clubs3 = → [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] (loan) | caps3 = 14 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2014–2015 | clubs4 = → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) | caps4 = 17 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2015 | clubs5 = [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] | caps5 = 4 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2015–2018 | clubs6 = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | caps6 = 106 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2018– | clubs7 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps7 = 6 | goals7 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2011 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 21:04, 9 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Ryan Marlowe Fredericks''' (born 10 October 1992) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full-back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. He has previously played for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]], [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]], [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]], [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] and [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]. ==Career== ===Tottenham Hotspur=== Born in [[Hammersmith]], London,{{Hugman|23100|accessdate=5 May 2018}} Fredericks joined the Tottenham [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Reserves and Academy|academy]] in July 2009.{{cite web |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=53280 |title=Ryan Fredericks profile |publisher=SoccerBase |accessdate=7 June 2018}} Although he was injured early in his career, he progressed through the academy to sign a professional contract with the club in July 2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/u18s-draw-at-coventry-090111/ |title=U18S DRAW AT COVENTRY |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=9 January 2011 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618190338/http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/u18s-draw-at-coventry-090111/ |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}}{{cite web |url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/tottenham-secure-exciting-trio-pro-deals-1010821 |title=Tottenham secure exciting trio to pro deals |publisher=Tribal Football Website |date=30 July 2010 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618185331/http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/tottenham-secure-exciting-trio-pro-deals-1010821 |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} In July 2011, Fredericks was awarded a new contract at the club.{{cite web |url=http://www.clubcall.com/tottenham-hotspur/young-trio-sign-lane-deals-1236737.html |title=Young trio sign Lane deals |publisher=Club Call |date=8 July 2011 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111106212749/http://www.clubcall.com/tottenham-hotspur/young-trio-sign-lane-deals-1236737.html |archivedate=6 November 2011 |deadurl=no}} Fredericks first appeared in Tottenham's first team as an unused substitute in February 2010, in an FA Cup fourth round replay win over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].{{cite news |title=Defoe ends Leeds adventure |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/leeds-vs-tottenham/report/174248 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=3 February 2010 |accessdate=18 June 2016}}{{not in source|reason=The article doesn't state that this was Fredericks' first time on the bench|date=July 2018}} A year later, Fredericks started his first game for Tottenham on 25 August 2011, against [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]], where he played on the right of midfield. He made his debut alongside [[Tom Carroll (English footballer)|Tom Carroll]] and [[Harry Kane]].{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/14569541.stm |title=Tottenham v Hearts |date=25 August 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport}} Fredericks then made his first Tottenham Hotspur appearance in two years, making a start, in the last group stage game of Europa League, where he won a penalty to allow [[Roberto Soldado]] converted the penalty successfully to score a hat-trick, in a 4–1 win over [[FC Anzhi Makhachkala|Anzhi Makhachkala]] on 12 December 2013.{{cite news |title=Tottenham Hotspur 4–1 Anzhi Makhachkala |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25303130 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 December 2013 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} In January 2014, Fredericks signed a contract with Tottenham Hotspur that would keep him at the club until 2016.{{cite news |title=Tottenham's Fredericks signs new deal & extends Millwall loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25979342 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} ====Loan spells==== On 10 August 2012, he signed on loan for [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19211896 "Brentford sign Tottenham's Ryan Fredericks on loan"] BBC Sport. 10 August 2012. Retrieved 30 September 2012. He made his debut the following day in a 1–0 defeat against [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19123932 "Walsall 1–0 Brentford"] BBC Sport. 11 August 2012. Retrieved 30 September 2012. He made his league debut on 18 August, in a 0–0 draw against [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19221495 "Bury 0–0 Brentford"] BBC Sport. 18 August 2012. Retrieved 30 September 2012. He made his home debut on 22 September, in a 1–0 win against [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19615006 "Brentford 1–0 Oldham"] BBC Sport. 22 September 2012. Retrieved 30 September 2012. Tottenham exercised the right to recall Fredericks to the Tottenham squad on 25 October 2012.{{cite web |title=Tottenham recall youngster from loan spell |url=http://www.westlondonsport.com/brentford/spurs-recall-youngster-from-loan-spell |work=West London Sport |date=25 October 2012 |accessdate=26 October 2012}} Reflecting about his time at Brentford, Fredericks said the move benefited, as the player he is today.{{cite news |title=Ryan Fredericks: Brentford loan spell helped me realise how far I was from being a first team player |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ryan-fredericks-brentford-loan-spell-13980357 |publisher=Get West London |date=1 December 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} On 17 January 2014, he switched to [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] for a three-month loan.{{cite news |title=Transfer window: Millwall sign Ryan Fredericks from Spurs |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25779252 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} He made his début the following day, a home match against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]], where he scored the only goal of the game with a lob from the right back position.{{cite news |title=Millwall 1–0 Ipswich Town |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25692448 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 January 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} After two appearances, Fredericks' loan spell at Millwall was extended until the end of the season.{{cite web |url=http://www.millwallfc.co.uk/news/article/fredericks-extension-1329462.aspx |title=Fredericks extension |publisher=Millwall F.C. |date=31 January 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618194100/http://www.millwallfc.co.uk/news/article/fredericks-extension-1329462.aspx |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} Fredericks became a first team regular at Millwall in the right-back position, making 14 appearances. On 28 August 2014, Fredericks joined [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] for a season-long loan.{{cite web |title=Tottenham Youngster Fredericks Joins Boro on Season Long Loan |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/280814-fredericks-joins-boro-1880453.aspx? |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |accessdate=28 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618194758/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/280814-fredericks-joins-boro-1880453.aspx |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no |df=dmy-all}} However, he remained on the sidelines until he was called up to the first team by manager [[Aitor Karanka]] following [[Damià Abella]]'s injury.{{cite web |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/180914-damia-injury-1926626.aspx |title=Damia Injury Blow Confirmed – Ryan Fredericks Set To Step In |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |date=18 September 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141220091441/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/180914-damia-injury-1926626.aspx |archivedate=20 December 2014 |deadurl=no}} His league debut came on 20 September 2014, where he played 90 minutes against former club Brentford and saw Middlesbrough win 4–0.{{cite news |title=Middlesbrough 4–0 Brentford |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29186838 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} He suffered a thigh injury during a match against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]],{{cite news |title=Middlesbrough 1 – 1 Blackburn Rovers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30155730 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 November 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} and was sidelined for a month.{{cite web |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/boro-fredericks-dimi-konstantopoulos-riverside-stadium-2121069.aspx |title=Fredericks Out for a Month – Dimi And Dani Doubts For Millwall |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |date=3 December 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141203202015/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/boro-fredericks-dimi-konstantopoulos-riverside-stadium-2121069.aspx |archivedate=3 December 2014 |deadurl=no}} He made his first appearance after returning from injury in a 1–0 win over Brentford on 31 January 2015.{{cite news |title=Brentford 0–1 Middlesbrough |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30962912 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} After appearing six times in nine appearance between February and March, Fredericks suffered a hamstring injury, which he sustained during a match against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] on 7 March 2015.{{cite web |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/boro-ryan-fredericks-dani-ayala-aitor-karanka-championship-2329916.aspx |title=Ryan Fredericks Out of Ipswich Clash – But Dani Ayala Could Return For Boro |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |date=12 May 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618202954/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/boro-ryan-fredericks-dani-ayala-aitor-karanka-championship-2329916.aspx |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} After returning to training in early-April,{{cite web |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/middlesbrough-boro-ryan-fredericks-watford-2371980.aspx |title=Ryan Fredericks Fit For Boro's Visit From Wigan – Easter Injury Update |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |date=2 April 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618203130/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/middlesbrough-boro-ryan-fredericks-watford-2371980.aspx |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} Fredericks remained on the sidelines until 25 April 2015, playing the first hour of a 4–3 loss to Fulham.{{cite news |title=Fulham 4–3 Middlesbrough |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32362246 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 April 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} Despite being sidelined, Fredericks went on to make 17 appearances for Middlesbrough before returning to his parent club.{{cite news |title=Five players who could be released by Boro this summer |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/five-players-who-could-released-9339900 |work=Gazette Live |date=27 May 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} ===Bristol City=== On 6 August 2015, Fredericks joined [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on a permanent transfer, signing a three-year contract, and was given the number twelve shirt ahead of the new season.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33801853 |title=Ryan Fredericks: Bristol City sign Tottenham Hotspur defender |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 August 2015 |accessdate=6 August 2015}}{{cite news |title=BRISTOL CITY: Robins announce squad numbers with summer signing Jonathan Kodjia opting for 22 shirt |url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/bristol-city-robins-announce-squad-numbers/story-27563896-detail/story.html |newspaper=Bristol Post |date=7 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}}{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Fredericks stated the club's "open and attacking" football was his motivation for joining.{{cite news |title=BRISTOL CITY: New-boy Ryan Fredericks pledges attacking approach |url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/bristol-city-new-boy-ryan-fredericks-pledges/story-27558487-detail/story.html |newspaper=Bristol Post |date=7 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} Fredericks made his Bristol City debut, in the opening game of the season, where he played as a right-midfield before switching to left-midfield, in a 2–0 loss away at [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].{{cite news |title=FULL-TIME: Sheffield Wednesday 2, Bristol City 0 |url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/time-sheffield-wednesday-v-bristol-city/story-27569658-detail/story.html |newspaper=Bristol Post |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} However, after just twenty-six days at the club and making only five appearance in all competitions for the club, it was reported that Fredericks was on the verge of leaving Bristol City, citing personal reasons and that he would be returning to London to an unnamed side,{{cite news |title=Ryan Fredericks to leave Bristol City 26 days after signing |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11065/9970837/ryan-fredericks-to-leave-bristol-city-26-days-after-signing |publisher=Sky Sports |date=29 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} which was later to be revealed as Fulham.{{cite news |title=Fulham close in on signing of Bristol City's Ryan Fredericks |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11065/9972499/fulham-close-in-on-signing-of-bristol-city8217s-ryan-fredericks |publisher=Sky Sports |date=30 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} ===Fulham=== [[File:Fulham Fredericks and O'Hara.JPG|thumb|left|250px|Ryan Fredericks (7) playing for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].]] He joined Championship club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on a three-year contract on 31 August 2015, with the fee undisclosed.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34107716 |title=Ryan Fredericks: Fulham sign Bristol City wing-back |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 August 2015 |accessdate=31 August 2015}} Fredericks made his Fulham debut, coming on as a substitute for [[Ben Pringle]] in the 62nd minute, in a 2–1 win against Blackburn Rovers on 13 September 2015.{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–1 Blackburn Rovers: Hosts win Championship thriller at Craven Cottage |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-blackburn/339597 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=13 September 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} He started out, playing in the right–back position for the next two matches before playing in the right–midfield position (whenever he came on as a substitute).{{cite news |title=Fulham v Bristol City: Who's back and who's missing for Whites – answers here |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-v-bristol-city-whos-10354643 |publisher=Get West London |date=29 October 2015 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham pay the penalty against Leeds United as Steve Evans earns a point on his return to management |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/fulham-pay-penalty-against-leeds-10308749 |publisher=Get West London |date=21 October 2015 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} For the rest of the season, Fredericks continued to play in either the right–back position and right–midfield position.{{cite news |title=Fulham boss insists there is a future for Wales international and ex-Swansea Jazz Richards – but it’s not where you think |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-insists-future-wales-10971823 |publisher=Get West London |date=29 February 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/february/16/fredericks-keep-it-going |title=Fredericks: Keep It Going |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=16 February 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728133010/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/february/16/fredericks-keep-it-going |archivedate=28 July 2018 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/march/06/fredericks-reaction |title=Fredericks: Pleasing Comeback. |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=6 March 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728133017/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/march/06/fredericks-reaction |archivedate=28 July 2018 |deadurl=no}} Despite suffering injuries during the 2015–16 season{{cite news |title=Fulham missing three defenders for trip to Sheffield Wednesday – plus update on Scott Parker |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-missing-three-defenders-trip-10077529 |publisher=Get West London |date=17 September 2015 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham v Birmingham City: Whites have no right-back for Blues visit – and seven others also miss out |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-v-birmingham-city-whites-10401105 |website=Get West London |date=6 November 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} Fredericks went on to make 36 appearances for Fulham in his first season. In the 2016–17 season, Fredericks spent the start of the season with ankle injury and was sidelined between 10–12 weeks following surgery.{{cite news |title=Fulham boss faces selection dilemma ahead of Preston clash |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-faces-selection-dilemma-11735948 |publisher=Get West London |date=11 August 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham defender primed for return |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-defender-primed-for-return-12002579 |publisher=Get West London |date=10 October 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} It wasn’t until on 18 October 2016 when he returned to the first team from injury, starting the match in the right–back position, in a 2–2 draw against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–2 Norwich City: Fulham fight back for draw |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-norwich/358260 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=15 October 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Since returning from injury, he regained his first team place, in the right–back position.{{cite news |title=Fulham thump hapless Huddersfield in five-star show |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-thump-hapless-huddersfield-five-12096899 |publisher=Get West London |date=29 October 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/december/19/ryan-fredericks-we-dominated |title=Fredericks: We Dominated |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=19 December 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728140507/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/december/19/ryan-fredericks-we-dominated |archivedate=28 July 2018 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite news |title=Best Fulham right-back: Denis Odoi or Ryan Fredericks? Boss offers his view |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/best-fulham-right-back-denis-12602438 |publisher=Get West London |date=14 February 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} In a match against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on 10 December 2016, Fredericks played a role for Fulham when he set up two goals, resulting a 4–4 draw.{{cite news |title=Wolves 4–4 Fulham: All square in eight-goal thriller |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/wolves-vs-fulham/358349 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=10 December 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Seven days later, on 17 December 2016, he provided another assist in a match against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]], setting up a goal for [[Floyd Ayité]], in a 2–2 draw.{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–2 Derby: Alex Pearce earns Rams point at Craven Cottage |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-derby/358367 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=17 December 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Three weeks later, on 8 January 2017, Fredericks played another role against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in [[2016–17 FA Cup#Third_Round_Proper|the third round of the FA Cup]] when he set up the equaliser, in a 2–1 win; his performance earned him Man of the Match.{{cite news |title=Fulham reaction in Cardiff from Ryan Fredericks, the boss, and Tom Cairney to FA Cup victory |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-reaction-cardiff-ryan-fredericks-12422723 |publisher=Get West London |date=8 January 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham player ratings against Cardiff – marks out of 10 for Whites |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-player-ratings-against-cardiff-12422379 |publisher=Get West London |date=8 January 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} However, in a match against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] on 4 February 2017, he was sent–off for a late tackle on Craig Gardner, in a 1–0 loss.{{cite news |title=Fulham suffer punishing defeat at Birmingham as former Tottenham man sent off |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/fulham-suffer-punishing-defeat-birmingham-12557492 |publisher=Get West London |date=4 February 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} After serving a three match suspension, Fredericks continued to regain his first team place in the right–back position for the rest of the season.{{cite news |title=Fulham's Denis Odoi believes rotation of full-backs is key ahead of Championship run-in |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulhams-denis-odoi-believes-rotation-12802953 |publisher=Get West London |date=27 March 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Norwich City vs Fulham: Pick your XI as our reporter goes with the same eleven that topped Ipswich |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/norwich-city-vs-fulham-pick-12885997 |publisher=Get West London |date=12 April 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Norwich City vs Fulham: Pick your XI as our reporter goes with the same eleven that topped Ipswich |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/norwich-city-vs-fulham-pick-12885997 |publisher=Get West London |date=12 April 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} He also played in both legs of the [[2017 English Football League play-offs|play-offs]], which saw Reading won 2–1 on aggregate.{{cite news |title=Ryan Fredericks insists Fulham are still confident going into second leg tie against Reading |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ryan-fredericks-insists-fulham-still-13031812 |publisher=Get West London |date=14 May 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Reading 1 – 0 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39853033 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Throughout the season, Fredericks’ performance was praised, due to his passing stats and pace.{{cite news |title=Why did Fulham pair Sone Aluko and Ryan Fredericks find a place in the WhoScored? team of the week? |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-pair-sone-aluko-ryan-12697954 |publisher=Get West London |date=6 March 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} At the end of the 2016–17 season, he went on to make 34 appearances in all competitions. In the 2017–18 season, Fredericks continued to regain his first team place in the right–back position at the start of the season.{{cite news |title=New season but 'same speech' for Fulham boss after 'hurtful' Norwich City draw |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-season-same-speech-fulham-13438602 |publisher=Get West London |date=6 August 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} After going on three league matches without a win, he then played a role when he set up a goal for [[Neeskens Kebano]], in a 2–1 win over [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on 26 August 2017.{{cite news |title=Ipswich Town 0–2 Fulham: Player ratings as Neeskens Kebano and Rui Fonte give the Cottagers victory |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/ipswich-town-0-2-fulham-13533343 |publisher=Get West London |date=26 August 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Two weeks later, on 13 September 2017, Fredericks provided his second assists this season, setting up the winning goal, in a 2–1 win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–1 Hull City: Stefan Johansen seals first Craven Cottage win of the season |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-hull-city/374694 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=13 September 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} He was an ever present in the first team since the start of the 2017–18 season until he suffered a foot injury that saw him missed one game.{{cite news |title=Fulham boss Slavisa Jokanovic gives update on Ryan Fredericks after missing Preston game through injury |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-slavisa-jokanovic-gives-13764482 |publisher=Get West London |date=15 October 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham vs Preston North End: Confirmed team news as Ryan Fredericks misses out through injury |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-vs-preston-north-end-13761702 |publisher=Get West London |date=14 October 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} After returning from injury against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 21 October 2017, he continued to regain his first team place.{{cite news |title=Aston Villa 2 – 1 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41618275 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 October 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham v Barnsley – TEAM NEWS from Craven Cottage |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-v-barnsley-team-news-14075876 |publisher=Get West London |date=23 December 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} His performance at Fulham this season attracted from clubs, such as, [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] and [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], but stayed at the club throughout January.{{cite news |title=How much do you think Swansea target Ryan Fredericks is worth at Fulham? |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/how-much-you-think-swansea-14134575 |publisher=Get West London |date=10 December 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} His contributions led Fulham reaching the [[2018 English Football League play-offs|play–offs]] and subsequently ended up reaching the [[Premier League]] after beating [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] 1–0 in the [[2018 EFL Championship play-off Final|final]], where he started and played 83 minutes before being substituted.{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–0 Derby County (2–1 agg.) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44026478 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 May 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Aston Villa 0 – 1 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44178427 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 May 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} For his performance, Fredericks was named in the EFL Championship team of the year in April 2018, along with teammate [[Ryan Sessegnon]] and [[Tom Cairney]].{{Cite web |title=EFL awards: Tom Cairney, Ruben Neves & Ryan Sessegnon on Championship shortlist |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43641225 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 April 2018 |accessdate=1 July 2018}} He’s also being named for the Championship Team of the Season.{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2018/april/03/efl-awards-2018 |title=EFL Awards 2018 |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=3 April 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728163155/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2018/april/03/efl-awards-2018 |archivedate=28 July 2018 |deadurl=no}} At the end of the 2017–18 season, Fredericks went on to make 48 appearances in all competitions. With his contract at Fulham expected to expire at the end of the 2017–18 season, Fredericks hinted about staying at Fulham.{{cite news |title=West Ham target Ryan Fredericks offers strongest hint yet that he wants to stay at Fulham |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/west-ham-target-ryan-fredericks-14507963 |publisher=Get West London |date=9 April 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham is the right place for Tom Cairney, Ryan Fredericks and Ryan Sessegnon – Jokanovic |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/tottenham-ryan-sessegnon-fulham-right-14496434 |publisher=Get West London |date=15 April 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} ===West Ham United=== Fredericks' free transfer to [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] was announced on 5 June 2018, joining on a four-year contract from Fulham.{{Cite web|title=Ryan Fredericks to join West Ham United|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/june/05-june/ryan-fredericks-join-west-ham-united}|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=5 June 2018|accessdate=5 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728162009/https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/june/05-june/ryan-fredericks-join-west-ham-united|archivedate=28 July 2018|deadurl=no}} He made his debut on 12 August in a 4–0 defeat by [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45073328 |title=Salah, Mane & Sturridge on target as Liverpool beat West Ham 4–0 |date=12 August 2018 |publisher= |accessdate=13 August 2018 |via=www.bbc.co.uk}} He scored his first goal for West Ham in their 8–0 defeat of [[Macclesfield Town F.C.|Macclesfield Town]] in the [[EFL Cup]] on 26 September 2018.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45569334 |title=West Ham 8–0 Macclesfield: Hammers thrash Macclesfield to reach fourth round |date=26 September 2018 |publisher= |accessdate=27 September 2018 |via=www.bbc.co.uk}} ==International career== Fredericks made a single appearance for the [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19 team]] in 2011, in a 3–0 defeat against the Netherlands.{{cite news |title=Three facts: Familiarise yourself with Boro's latest signing Ryan Fredericks |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/three-facts-familiarise-yourself-boros-7683936 |work=Gazette Live |date=28 August 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} Fredericks is also eligible to represent [[Guyana national football team|Guyana]].{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/apr/14/millwall-matthew-briggs-guyana |title=Millwall's Matthew Briggs rediscovers his roots with Guyana success |first=Nick |last=Ames |date=14 April 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian}} ==Personal life== Upon joining Fulham, Fredericks revealed that he had been a district champion in the 100m and the triple jump and had been offered athletics scholarships as a youth.{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/december/11/the-need-for-speed |title=The Need For Speed |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=11 December 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618212438/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/december/11/the-need-for-speed |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 9 February 2019}} {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and
